body:
(maybe) fixes https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/5025

This changes `EmbeddedBrowser` to a singleton class so that we can maintain one JxBrowser `Engine` and `Browser` with a folder for the browser data.
![Screen Shot 2020-11-10 at 10 09 58 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6379305/98714064-4a369380-233d-11eb-921f-2e6bc7064db7.png)

comment_data.body: Do we want this to be an application singleton or a per project (per IntelliJ window) singleton? I'm guessing the 2nd one. There are several places in the code base where we have per-project singletons. You register them in the plugin's xml file and then have a slightly different singleton getter. See for example `FlutterReloadManager.getInstance(Project project)`.

getInstance(project)
I think we'd want separate instances for each window.
I don't think IntelliJ allows opening two windows on a single project, but if it does that could be a problem.
Ack forgot about this! Changed to per-project.
Hmm.. I can't do it easily, so hopefully only one project per window.

commit.message: Set user-data folder for embedded browser
Use separate engine for each project

repo.description: Flutter makes it easy and fast to build beautiful mobile apps.
repo.name: flutter-intellij

title: Set user-data folder for embedded browser
